titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. F. Y. Young and William Burge, Indictment
CWG6563

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } May Term 1865
F Y Young and Thomas Burge
The Grand Jury of Muhlenberg County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse F Y Young and William Beurge of the Crime of Robbery Committed as follows viz.

The said F Y Young and William Berge on the 15th day of December 1864 in the County aforesaid, willfully and feloniously took and carried away Fifteen hundred -- worth of dry goods and merchandise the property of S A Jackson from his immediate presence and possession and against his the said S A Jacksons will by then and there putting him in fear of some immediate injury to his person from arms violence and force and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

A N Davis
foreman Grand Jury
E. P. Campbell atty
for Commonwealth

Witnesses
S. A Jackson
Tolbert Robertson
John S. Young
Robert Glenn
Jos Fox

endorsed "a true bill A N Davis foreman ^of the^ Grand Jury"
Filed in open Court May 15, 1865
"Bench Warrant to issue & bail fixed at $500 each --

A Copy att
J H Reno C M C C
By Tho. J. Jones D. C.

Muhlenberg Cir Ct
Comth of Ky
vs } Copy of Indictment
F. Y. Young &c
2 cases
Robbery & unlawful carrying away property
Pardoned
1th May 1865
